page.title: 10WALTON HALL SPECIAL SCHOOL
page.content: Walton Hall School caters for Staffordshire children with moderate learning difficulties. Several also have behavioural problems. The local Education Authority funds the school. The procedure of admitting a child oftens takes a year. It is the only special school in the County that has residential places for girls. The School opened in 1948 with 48 girls in one house, in 1971 it became a mixed day school for 5-16 year-olds. Now there are 101 pupils (10 boys and 15 girls are residents) and 10 teachers. There are 25 other staff: housemothers, cooks, kitchen help and caretaker. Boarding children rise at 7.30am, school starts at 9.00am and ends at 3.25pm. Several children travel by taxi. Residential children go home for the weekend on Fridays.
